text: Hi, searched for lazy load in the community and here in slack but could not find a tutorial/guide.  It seems from the discussion that you figured it out. Could you guys help me implement lazy loading on website pages and blog posts ?

the HubSpot cms course is what i recommend.

can we atleast disable simple or advanced from the module editor?

I'm not too familiar with JS to be able to diagnose your issue. One thing I am noticing though is your ajax call to a php file. I am assuming the form is on a non-HubSpot website correct (just checking)?
I would try using the full path to the url (as i believe the embedded forms get placed using iframe's so it might not resolve properly to the url)

is it possible to use jquery to target form fields on a HubSpot landing page? i just did a "view source" on my landing page and the form isnt actually on the page. It just says <div id="hs_form_target_widget_5370941415"></div> and it looks like some other method is being used to drop the form into the page.

Hey Ankit, I'd look at taking a different approach personally. Unfortunately HubSpot doesn't offer many custom validation options in fields, but what I would do in this case is actually handle the validation myself using a custom form (either HTML or otherwise) and then submit the form's data using a separate function, as described here:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>

That way you have control over preventing an invalid submission at the page-level.
Hey it worked out. Thanks for your time.
What was your solution if you dont mind sharing?

Hey everyone looking for a little bit of insight... We want to do a brand domain switch. Is it easier to get the brand domain add on so we can host HubSpot content at 2 domains and just turn one off when we are ready to pull the trigger or is it better to simply "replace" the brand domain when we are ready?
I was JUST looking at this yesterday and was going to post this later today! Following....
My thought was the brand domain add-on, make the site, then turn off the initial brand. Would love to hear from an HS person on this.  <@U3VN3LMME> any thoughts on this?
Haha thanks <@U2H3TT8F2>

Has anyone ever run into any issues with page caching? We pushed a staged page live today to replace an outdated events page, and even an hour later now we still can't see the new page live. When i edit the page i can tell the new content is there and HubSpot support had me add ?x to the url to see that the page is there and maybe a caching issue with our host.
<https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/So-you're-having-HubSpot-Caching-Issues%3F>

yeah that works like a charm for me (great work btw!) but i'm concerned how long its taking for anyone else to see the change, boss wanted to share the updated page in a new campaign today but i worry no one will be able to see it
The HubSpot cache is local to your local cdn
so likely people in your city might see what you’re seeing for 15 mins or so but someone a major city over will already see the live content

interesting, i am in nyc so i'd imagine if thats the case i might see the updated page by now, just very weird as pages i've edited after that one i could see the changes live immediately but this one page is stuck, maybe i should make an edit and see if that jumpstarts things
this is interesting. So that I fully understand the use case, what are you trying to accomplish with the brand change?
looking
You can DM me the page,  so I can take a look.

for our client, its a rebrand of their company. So essentially, brand `ABC Company` is rebranding as `XYZ Company` with a fresh look. So for this, we need to have `<http://xyz.com|xyz.com>` added to their HubSpot so we can make design the appropriate templates for the site, then we will need to switch all the pages and blogs from using `<http://abc.com/page-names|abc.com/page-names>` to `<http://xyz.com/page-names|xyz.com/page-names>`
like a migration but inside the same portal
the problem comes in that when doing this, the only option is for clients to have to purchase an additional brand domain for another 700/mo when they are already on enterprise
was wondering if there was an easier way to do this
kind of like a how to guide for migrating your content to a new domain in the same HubSpot portal
Same case for me

my thought process was/is:
- brand domain add-on
- Add domain
- Create new templates for the designs
- Make use of a hosts file locally to point the site to the new domain (so its hidden and not available during the redesign process)
- Clone all the content to the new domain
- point domain to HubSpot so it is now the CMS for it
- Launch site
- setup original domain on an external server and put redirect in config file
- turn off old site from HS and redirect to external server for redirects
- Remove all old site content
- remove old site from HubSpot (which should get rid of additional cost of brand domain add-on
- Profit $$$

Only difference is we aren't switching any design templates, so my plan was to simply replace the old brand domain with the new one.

BUT now, they want to add a new subdomain and have it be live now under the new brand domain, am I going to run into issues switching the old brand stuff to the new brand stuff if we setup a subdomain under the new brand domain now? Is this the most efficient want to do this?

if a company was rebranding outside of using the HS CMS, it would be easier as you usually setup a clone of the environment and make adjustments there then just point the dns to the new setup.

it might be beneficial for HubSpot to look into having the ability for users who are rebranding clients on HubSpot to have a way to clone their current portal and do all the configs in that, then its a simple one time sync of all contact data and then turn down of old portal

Maia brings up a good point if you were to simple replace the primary domain, would that bring all your content that was previously on those domains to the new primary or would you have to reconfigure all those pages/posts?

My understanding is that everything just switches over, my issue is what happens if HubSpot content already exists at the new domain, especially if the new one I'm setting up isn't going to be the primary, we need the existing primaries to stay the same
Sorry if this is confusing! lol
<@U5SGFUU80> <@U6W3H6YN8> would love some of your thoughts on the above problem. Certainly one we've heard before.
It depends on what browsers you need to support
i use blazy.js as it still supports ie10
very easy to implement

<@U2H3TT8F2> If you connect the new subdomain(s) as redirects and then wait until they're fully resolving you should be able to swap them out with the old via the replace brand option under advanced settings.  <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cms-general/replace-your-brand-domain> and as long as the pages themselves weren't overridden in page > page settings > domains box everything should just switch over.

Maia, I'd add the new subdomain as a redirect too in preparation and then set it as secondary or whatever you need after you make the brand domains switch.  It should be fairly instantaneous once the switch for brands has been done.
OK, so getting the brand domain add on now is still what you'd suggest? Just setup redirects?

No, I wouldn't recommend getting the brand domain add-on in this case, I would just set the net new brand subdomains up as redirect domains and then use the brand replace feature when the customer's ready to cut over.
Thank you!
Anytime :slightly_smiling_face:
sounds good, i guess the basic stuff: chrome, safari, firefox and ie10

i am rather new to js, but from what i read here <http://dinbror.dk/blog/blazy/?ref=demo-page#Usage> i would have to create a placeholder image and replace the src for each image below the fold. I am on the right path?
<https://www.cheerup.ro/> this is a website page and the blog page i need to change <https://www.cheerup.ro/blog/ce-este-cabina-foto-si-cum-te-ajuta-la-nunta>
you would replace the `src` with `data-src`
that add a class of `b-lazy` to those items
i created the pages in visual manager, so as i understand i would need to manually replace src with data-src
or is it possible to create a module to be used across multiple pages?

Hi everyone, I'm trying to run a report on a blog that I set up a few months ago. When I go into analytics, it takes me to a page where I can view all of the different blog posts that we've done and tracks all of the data for them. However, I want to pull a report that shows how many people have visited the homepage of the blog. I can't seem to see this on the back end. Does anyone have any tricks, tips or general help?? Thanks in advance.
